v.v: Man, who is born of woman,
He sprouts from the ground like a flower and is cut down;
Do you look at any of these?
Who can bring something clean out of something unclean? No one.
Manâ€™s days are determined.
Look away from him that he may rest,

v: lives only a few days and is full of trouble.
he flees like a shadow and does not last.
Do you bring me into judgment with you?
The number of his months is with you;
you have appointed his limits that he cannot pass.
so that he may enjoy his day like a hired man if he can do so.

v.v: There can be hope for a tree;
Though its root grows old in the earth,
yet even if it only smells water, it will bud
But man dies; he becomes weak;
As water disappears from a lake,
so people lie down and do not rise again.

v: if it is cut down, it might sprout again,
so that its tender stalk does not disappear.
and its stump dies in the ground,
and send out branches like a plant.
indeed, man stops breathing, and then where is he?
and as a river loses water and dries up,
Until the heavens are no more, they will not awake
nor be roused out of their sleep.

v.v: Oh, that you would hide me away in Sheol away from troubles,
If a man dies, will he live again?
You would call, and I would answer you.
You would number and care for my footsteps;
My transgression would be sealed up in a bag;

v: and that you would keep me in private until your wrath is over,
that you would set me a fixed time to stay there and then call me to mind!
If so, I would wish to wait all my weary time there
until my release should come.
You would have a desire for the work of your hands.
you would not keep track of my sin.
you would cover up my iniquity.

v.v: But even mountains fall and come to nothing;
the waters wear down the stones;
You always defeat him, and he passes away;
If his sons are honored, he does not know it;
He feels only the pain of his own body,

v: even rocks are moved out of their place;
their flooding washes away the dust of the earth.
Like this, you destroy the hope of man.
you change his face and send him away to die.
and if they are brought low, he does not see it.
and he mourns for himself.
